definition: (political) reform/revitalization/modernization
abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)
the Japanese Meiji Restoration of 1868
the reformist faction
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
everyone participates in reforms (idiom)/to replace the old with new/to reform and start afresh
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty

sentences.english: Yan Fu was one of the representative figures of the reform idea.
sentences.chinese: 严复是维新思想的代表人物之一。

sentences.english: This thesis is trying to study the legal ideas of early reform from macrocosmic and microcosmic point of view.
sentences.chinese: 本文从宏观和微观两方面研究早期维新派的法律思想。

sentences.english: The Qing government was conservative diehards against the reformers change.
sentences.chinese: 清政府顽固派却抱残守缺，反对维新变革。

sentences.english: Firstly, it discusses the formation background of Civil Right Thought of Reform Clique.
sentences.chinese: 首先论述了戊戌维新民权思想形成的背景。

sentences.english: The second part analyzed the movement of anti-foot-binding launched by Wuxu Reformists from the aspects of thoughts and observations.
sentences.chinese: 从思想言论方面对戊戌维新派的不缠足进行阐述。

sentences.english: Ma Jianzhong's diplomatic ideology was an important component part of his idea of reform.
sentences.chinese: 马建忠的外交思想是其维新思想的重要组成部分。

sentences.english: Japan accelerated its invasion and external expansion after the Meiji Restoration.
sentences.chinese: 日本在明治维新以后加快对外侵略扩张。

sentences.english: They stressed the importance of literary translation, too.
sentences.chinese: 此外，维新派还强调对翻译人才的培养。

sentences.english: Song Yuren was an outstanding person of ideals and integrity on reform.
sentences.chinese: 宋育仁是一位杰出的维新志士。

sentences.english: The fifth part was a basic summary to the movement of anti-foot-binding launched by Wuxu Reformists.
sentences.chinese: 对戊戌时期维新派领导的不缠足运动的一个基本评析。

sentences.english: County student members, and Chu Sang camp with a well-known reformers.
sentences.chinese: 县学生员，与朱德裳同为著名维新派人士。

sentences.english: Influenced by Reform Ideological Trend, he broke away from the tie of feudal thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 在维新思潮影响下，他从封建思想束缚中摆脱出来。

sentences.english: Seemingly, success in Japan should be attributed to Meiji Reform or Restoration implemented in 1868.
sentences.chinese: 表面上看，日本的成功归因于1868年的明治维新。

sentences.english: After the Meiji Restoration, Japan quickly went on the path of capitalist development.
sentences.chinese: 日本明治维新后，迅速走上资本主义的发展道路。

sentences.english: So we think that legislation design of the amount in economy crime needs change.
sentences.chinese: 窃以为，我国经济犯罪数额之立法设计亟待维新。

sentences.english: The early reformers used the traditional resources in many aspects.
sentences.chinese: 早期维新派对传统资源的利用包含多个方面。

definition: to recover one's power or authority/restoration (of a past regime)

coup by Dowager Empress Cixi 慈禧太后[Ci2 xi3 tai4 hou4] ending the 1898 attempt to reform the Qing dynasty

party member/partisan

Western learning (intellectual movement in the late Qing)/also called 洋務運動|洋务运动
